alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 01 at 6:01PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .A winter storm will begin to impact the area Monday evening and persist through Tuesday. Freezing rain will develop Monday evening and gradually transition to a wintry mix Tuesday from south to north. Total ice accumulations of a quarter inch, with locally higher amounts, will be possible across portions of northeast Iowa into southeast Minnesota. This wintry mix will then switch over to snow starting late Tuesday afternoon with some accumulations expected. ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Significant icing expected. Ice accumulations up to a quarter of an inch, with locally higher amounts possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...In Iowa, Mitchell and Floyd Counties. In Minnesota, Dodge and Mower Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There remains the potential for this storm to shift north or south. Travelers are urged to keep up to date with the latest forecasts and statements concerning this potentially hazardous travel situation.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions.
